it's weakly armed, but should have fighters guarding it most of the time. It's pretty well armoured though

'Reaction Systems LTD never expected a war to break out, but a war broke out indeed, and they were left simply to choose which side to take. They decided that they would choose later, and prepare for the war. They decided to make a small capitol ship, to carry cargo and occasionally passengers. This capitol ship was poorly armed, so it needs fighters to escort it. Now all Reaction systems LTD. have to do is to choose which side they want to support.

Reaction Systems LTD talked to the CEO of HKA, and have sealed a deal.'

Comapany name: Reaction Systems LTD. (found it's flag and it just sounded cool)

Edited September 26, 2014 by Spartwo

What are you people talking about? The update isn't out yet.

Yeah, I just saw squadcast, and during 0.25 we get a "grace period" during which both versions coexist and ships don't break. 0.26 is probably the update I have been most hyped about, since I decided I liked it better than 0.25 some time ago, so many things have been left for that one. Still, the explosions might change that opinion somewhat when the cinematics with the VAB on ruins start coming up.

Rune. All military-minded players must be VERY happy right now!

Yeah, I just saw squadcast, and during 0.25 we get a "grace period" during which both versions coexist and ships don't break. 0.26 is probably the update I have been most hyped about, since I decided I liked it better than 0.25 some time ago, so many things have been left for that one. Rune. All military-minded players must be VERY happy right now!

Ok so can someone give me a list of what .25 (and now .26) will have and their features?

Ok so can someone give me a list of what .25 (and now .26) will have and their features?

Well, there's an article about that. Here: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/content/302-The-0-25-Plan

Basically what didn't make the cut in time are the Mk III parts, some of spaceplane plus and new FX for the engines (explosion effects, and some sound and engines FX are also in there). And the secret feature are the destroyable buildings. The feature that required "tons of new assets" is left for 0.26, along with any hopes of a reworked stock aerodynamic model. Or so I gather, at least, I could be wrong on any and all points and am in no way in possession of secret information of any kind.

Rune. I really thought 0.25 was going to be the "Plane Special" or something like it.

Phoenix Aerospace wishes to submit the Capital Ships of the PGN (Phoenix Galactic Navy): the Behemoth, Swordbreaker Mk III, and last but definitely not least, the Vehemence-Class Battlecruiser.

Though I would like to see these used by GMI, I don't mind if HKA uses them. All three ships are stock.

The Behemoth:

Although the original Behemoth, a gift from Project Genesis, predates Phoenix Aerospace, that doesn't mean it's outdated. This is actually the Behemoth Mk II. I believe 1 and 2 fire the missiles.

The Swordbreaker Mk III:

The Swordbreaker Mk III is the first one painted with the colors of Phoenix Aerospace. Though the original Swordbreaker was made entirely by me, the Mk II was made with the help of AlTi AD. Since the Mk III is an upgraded version of the Mk II, I still give AlTi AD credit for helping build the ship. 1 triggers the engines, 2 and 4 fire the front missiles, 3 triggers the solar panels, 5, 6, 7, and 8 fire the broadside missiles. The Swordbreaker got its name from a post made by zekes, when he said the Drekevak was a space pen in a sword fight. During recent testing, a Swordbreaker Mk III, which was out of ammunition, rammed full throttle into one of the sides of a Vehemence Class, and not only did both ships manage to survive, the collision barely scratched the paint.

Now, last but not least, the Vehemence Class Battlecruiser:

View from inside:

The Vehemence Class Battlecruiser, a large, 400-part battlecruiser, made in cooperation with Project Genesis, is the newest of the three PGN Capital Ships, as well as the largest. I believe it's 1 to launch the missiles, and 2 to extend the solar panels. During recent battle testing, a Swordbreaker Mk III rammed a Vehemence Class. Not only did both ships survive, they were undamaged. Weighing in at approx. 110 tonnes, the Vehemence Class is one serious warship.

Edited April 18, 2015 by FallingIntoBlack

Ok, filming of episode 20 is going well. However I've decided to make it entirely cinematic, so the length is going to take a turn for the worse. Although I really am pulling out all the stops to make sure this is as good as it can possibly be, what I've written is the kind of thing that makes hearts skip beats and the cinematography (so far) isn't far behind the work I did on the

from Antarctica.

PS: That carrier looks insane Spartwo, how many parts?

So as part of my Revival Protocol, I decided I would replace the Glory Class Carrier and make something a bit more modern.

So to prepare for .25 I played around with SP+ and here are the results.

Carries 4 Cherub Class fighters. Also can hold 11 kerbals

I won't be submitting it yet as I want to make her stock when .25 comes out.

Dorchester Class Heavy Carrier?
